website_summaries.verdict: A good, budget-friendly way to improve the bass end of your car's audio system. Better than most factory speakers.
pros: Uses a standard, reliable speaker design so you can expect years of consistent performance
The speaker itself is made of common components, making unexpected repairs and replacements easy to do if necessary
cons: Sound output can be lackluster when paired with a system with higher wattage output

customer_reviews.title: Wont submit review!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this guy hooked up for a couple months now and on my usual way to work, it was on fire in my trunk! Luckily I had something to put it out because the damage could have been worse.
customer_reviews.author: Deion Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy for the low cost.  Was very surprised with the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the money in my DIY bluetooth boombox. I will purchase again. This sub really knocks for the small footprint and small price. I have it paired with four 6.5" and a 2 channel bluetooth amp board with 100 watts for this sub.
customer_reviews.author: JB Hay

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working(replaced)
customer_reviews.text: it was working good, did the whole keeping volume down to break in the speaker. not even a month and the speaker stopped working.... tested a different speaker just to make sure it wasn't any wiring problem but the other speaker works fine... not sure if this can be covered by warranty? (update) amazon replaced the speaker and its been working perfectly for a few months now!
customer_reviews.author: christian flores

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap woofer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early. Looks pretty well built for the cost. The foam backing on the box side of the woofer mounting surface was a unexpected bonus. Will be hooked up to about 75watts RMS as a stock amplified woofer upgrade, which I foresee having no issue with as I'm sure this woofer is heavily overrated as far as wattage. But that's the norm these days, unicorn numbers. 😂 Update 4/21/18: This 12" actually slaps! Like, I am blown away. I've had a lot of systems, and a lot of woofers, and this thing definitely surpassed expectation. Touché Boss.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It's not a perfect match to replace the stock speaker
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the stock JBL rear subwoofer in my 2001 Toyota Avalon. It's not a perfect match to replace the stock speaker, but I was able to install it without too much trouble. Sounds fine with the otherwise-stock system, and for the price I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: andrew vied

customer_reviews.title: CXX 10 Chaos
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Make certain to break in properly, otherwise will sound horrible. This is second one I have had, so I knew what to expect. Not boomy like a 12", but tighter more controlled bass. No way it handles the advertised power, but sounds decent nonetheless. I am pushing 200 watts to it and sound pretty good, not competition good, but sound filling where factory speakers can't produce. I have it mounted in a space saving .65 cu. ft. sealed box with stuffing added in trunk of 09 Pontiac G6 sedan.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell A

customer_reviews.title: Good Sub and Light Weight.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Memphis Power Reference that was deteriorating. This sub is lighter, I didn't have to wire two voice coils, sounds the same (maybe better once broken in) as the $120 sub it replaced, and I got it under $20. Don't get stuck on the fancy name brands, this thing hits!
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Blew after just a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in a box in my garage running off a 150 watt RMS channel from a home theater amplifier. Only used it when I was in the garage working on something and it blew after 4 months. Cone completely separated from the coil resulting in a horrible rattling noise. First and last time I'll buy a Boss sub.
customer_reviews.author: Mishael Baggott

customer_reviews.title: For the money can't be beat great lil subs I have two 10s and 1100watt in ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money can't be beat great lil subs I have two 10s and 1100watt in my truck I would buy again boss audio is underrated in the cat audio world
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Works for my 2000 Avalon- can't beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Avalon and Lexus ES 300 are basically the same vehicle, mostly. The difference in the Avalon is that the bracket that this fits into is actually plastic, so no need to cut anything out or change the bracket. This just fits right in, but you'll need to drill holes in the bracket to keep this firmly in place. The screen that went on top of the original won't fit on this one, but I just left it off. Works like a boss! :)
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, just don't push it
customer_reviews.text: This is a $20 sub. It says 600 W max, but let's be honest. I've run $500 subs at 600 W+ and 4 ohms and even they were pushed to the limit. I bought this as a replacement for my home theater to run at 8 ohms and 125 W. It sounds great in this scenario. If you're wanting to push this to test its limits, it will fry. Spend the extra money if you're wanting booming bass and extreme wattage. Also, an 8" sub is designed for mid level acoustics . Go at least 10-12" subs for deep, low level extremes. This is a great bargain sub to be run in light to moderate levels.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn St John

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest, luck of the draw if you get a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Using in a box, it started baffling and when I checked the cone rubber had come off. Had to take to a speaker shop to be repaired. Repairman said it was probably old stock and the glue had degraded. Easy repair for him but it still cost me as much as I paid for the speaker. Update April 23 2019. Cone gone again. Really a pretty poorly made speaker. I'm only running 80watts to it from an old school Punch 40x2. Disappointed. How do I contact Boss for the 3 year online warrantee?
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: These are really good speakers. I have them pushing everything from around ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really good speakers. I have them pushing everything from around 300 hertz down. I have two 8" in a sealed box. They dont slap hard but for 15 dollar speakers they do all right. I plan on making them my mid bass and getting a better quality sub at some point. But if you just want to replace your factory system with a little bit more bump, for 15 bucks these are great.
customer_reviews.author: reedo breezo

customer_reviews.title: Lota BANG for the BUCK!
customer_reviews.text: Had to put speakers in a classic car without ruining original interior with big ugly door speakers. these fit nicely into the fender wells behind the kick panels with only slight cutting to enlarge the hole that's already there. Mounted a Boss dual coil 8" sub-woofer in the back center of the rear shelf. Hooked the left and right rear speaker wires, each, to one of the 2 coils. Result: Nice full sound with additional bass added from the sub-woofer. These perform nicely for such small speakers. Happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Bechap

customer_reviews.title: 2001 Tahoe very happy w sound!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install in my 2001 Tahoe rear factory sub replacement. Took 15 mins. Had to drill new holes for new speaker. But fit nicely and sounds great! For a 8" it thumps! See pics for my factory sub lol . Was wasted. Already replaced all other speakers in truck and now sounds amazing! Very happy w purchase. Not test of time will tell if it holds up? As I read alot of other people are having issues w the subs lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Speer

customer_reviews.title: Wow just wow
customer_reviews.text: I love these subs😍 bought them thinking they were shallow mount. A bit shocked when I inboxed them but I am soooo glad I got them. These things pound!!!! I have had a number of good quality subs over the years and these are so far my favorites. Will be buying them again soon.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley B.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have it installed in a kenwood pre amplified box. Amp pushes 250 watts. This little sub takes it with ease. Base sounds good inside a Yaris hatchback but isnt so much you can hear me coming down the road. I love this little sub. My only complaint is the seller has repeatedly bugged me to leave a review instead of being patient and letting me test it first and make sure its a good product. Chances of me buying from this seller again is low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Built two speaker boxes using the 10" version of the sub paired with one of the Boss 600W 2 channel amps. Speaker box used dimensions supplied by the OEM in the instruction manual for a non-ported design. I had low expectations for performance as these were being driven off high-outputs from a factory automotive deck. That said, speakers sounded great; tight bassline with no buzz or floof, and on point after setting up the amp's low pass filter and level.
customer_reviews.author: Spree Powersport Products

customer_reviews.title: Perfect device for a factory replacement without changing the tiny amplifier behind the radio.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this cannot be beat. It has more bass than I was expecting. I like volume with some clear bass, not over the top, and this nailed it. Was a replacement woofer for my Tahoe. Was worried I'd need to replace the amp for it, but it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pendergast320

customer_reviews.title: Great sub, but be careful installing the ugly and breakable plastic surround.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sub, especially for the price. The specs are wrong in the description: the actual sensitivity is 87db, and the watts are inflated, as usual. The ugly grey plastic surround cracked when tightening the first screw, so if you want the look of it on there then be very careful screwing it on.
customer_reviews.author: I. S.

customer_reviews.title: Once again I gave the verified Amazonian reviewers overall positives ...
customer_reviews.text: Once again I gave the verified Amazonian reviewers overall positives a shot and ordered a single unit to replace the blown driver in my 8" Bazooka Tube and oh man this driver actually takes 75 watts rms with zero issues and pounds way harder then the factory driver did. This low dollar driver is an upgrade over the factory Bazooka driver.
customer_reviews.author: Blaksvn

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome. High quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Product is beautiful... Great quality.. I tried to install in my 2000 Toyota Avalon but doesn't work. It's probably something in my car to do with the factory amp as I also upgraded the head unit at the same time. I have high hopes for this but I gotta figure out what's wrong before I give a full review.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $500 sub, and it blew within a few weeks, so as a temporary I bought this one, and honestly I can’t tell a difference, this is an excellent sub for an excellent price, this temporary sub, is now a permanent. Love It!!!
customer_reviews.author: TDogz07

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Light, hits pretty hard, sounds great. I would expect nothing less from boss. They do a good job. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lewis

customer_reviews.title: No Brainer!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my OEM 8" speaker with the Boss and now I am listening to awesome bass. It is not the best bass but for $20, you can't go wrong. My 2009 Accord sounds better than my wife's 2015 Toyota Avalon Premium Sound system. (I did change all the other 6.5 OEM speakers too)
customer_reviews.author: Golphnut

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I kept it in the box waiting to get my amplifier. It was past the 30 day warranty. Voice coil froze the first time I hooked it up
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Also works to replace subwoofer speaker in a home theater system
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is intended for car audio, I bought this to replace a rattling speaker in a subwoofer of a home theater system. It worked like a charm... and saved me hundreds of dollars over replacing a complete amplified subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Tazalanche

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage I e used their amps they are ok but this sub is trash lasted 2 days with 200 watt amp and started popping and Smokin save your time and money
customer_reviews.author: James r.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sub for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this to replace my in home surround sound subwoofer speaker because it had blown due to it being 16 years old (the box and power amp are fine) simple as taking the old one out of the box and plugging this one in and boom. I have great sounding bass back in my home theater. Amazing product for the price. You cant beat that price of $20 bucks ish. I'm sure this would sound great in the correct box for a car or truck. Also it is not a very deep subwoofer so it will fit in compact boxes too.
customer_reviews.author: Derek G.

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: After installing my speakers the"sound quality"is HORRIBLE,so I had the wattage actually tested. The wattage of these speakers is NO WHERE NEAR the"falsely advertised"1100 watts",..I wish I could request a full refund. I went on YouTube and was able to find SEVERAL terrible reviews by other people who've purchased these same speakers. Once again they also realized that these speakers ARE NOT 1200 WATTS and they sound like garbage. My hard earned $ that I spent for 2 of these was a waste and I feel deceived. I wish I would have done my research and due,-diligence before I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely cannot beat it for the price !
customer_reviews.text: So far so good very impressed with the sound quality for the price. I’ve had kicker systems in the past and I would say this is probably 90% as good. it booms. Competition quality no but for anything else 100% yes. We will see how long everything lasts
customer_reviews.author: Grant Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Cant Handle Much
customer_reviews.text: Ok so Im not going with a super low review on this because while they did fail, I was using a fully bridged 1200watt amp. So I shouldnt have cheaped out on the speakers. That said though, if you back a pair of these with maybe a 600 or 800 watt amp, they sound beautiful. Very little of that *thwop* sound cheap subwoofers often have when they kick. In fact I didnt hear any at all. VERY large range low lows are quieter, but definately there. Everything that comes out of these is clear and enjoyable. For 2 8 inch subs at $20 friggin dollars, they're amazing. Cant praise enough. Just dont roast them like I did lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kingston

customer_reviews.title: Great little sub....almost
customer_reviews.text: Great little sub for the limited space in my Tacoma. Sub sounds great, had to return one because it quit working after a day, but Amazon handled the exchange quickly. For the price you can't beat it! Update: Sub did not hold up...stopped working after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level sub
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for someone who is just getting into premium sound but is on a budget. These subs have a nice punch, but there are on the lower end of quality so do not overpower them or play them too loudly or they won't hold up for very long.
customer_reviews.author: J. Be

customer_reviews.title: I'd never thought I'd gave a 5 stars to a Boss product
customer_reviews.text: These Boss subs blew me away. I usually go with Pioneer, Kenwood for my needs. I bought these and I'm very happy with my decision. I was very skeptical, I had them in my cart for weeks and decided to give them a try I'm very surprised with the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: drixn5078

customer_reviews.title: Low Price and low expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I figured it was affordable and pretty good but, to my expectations, i was let down. I wasnt surprised that it wasnt as loud as I liked to be so i just gave this speaker to my brother who didnt need a loud sub woofer. I invested a little bit more money and bought a Kicker CVR comp.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker Boss!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 12 inch 1400 watt Cx122. Boss gets another 5 star review from me on this purchase! I bought two of the 12’s after hearing how well the 8 inch sub sounded. I’m still finishing up the build but I will show you what I have so far. They are down facing for my home theater system. Both woofers are sharing 1 fosi audio 300watt sub amp. I was worried it wasn’t going to be enough power but these things shake my whole house! Thanks Boss for making yet another great product!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Burritt

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptal at first but was very impressed in the end. I did run the speaker through the proper break-in process and was properly blown away by the power that came out of it. The only Cons I could think of is the fact that it you have to be very careful when screwing in the speaker because it is very easy to crack the plastic and break the airtight seal. My last thought would be it is a great, cheap, powerful sub. But definitely not up to the specified power rated, but still pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Drentlaw

customer_reviews.title: cheap comes with negatives
customer_reviews.text: speaker works and seems to handle 150 watts rms. it was much smaller than the sub it replaced so i had to drill new holes. we will see if it lasts
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Young

customer_reviews.title: OK ish
customer_reviews.text: the price was good but the soldering points behind the cone were garbage I had to keep resoldering it myself to keep it going but what do you know it's still going as we speak today
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers for the money! Not the most clear speakers but by far the cheapest and still very good quality compared to some other cheap subs.
customer_reviews.author: Randy E Martens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is perfect. I have a 2000 Tahoe and it fit perfectly in the box spot in the back and is a great replacement. Highly suggest this if your just looking for a replacement. Not meant for high end use.
customer_reviews.author: BeantowneS

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad deal
customer_reviews.text: Not the loudest but what do you expect form a small sub. Great for some one looking for a little bass and a upgrade from factory. I have it replacing a factory 8" in a 99 Ford explorer sport. And I'm pleased with waht I've got out of it
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McNevin

customer_reviews.title: Great for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great for a cheap sub ive had it for 5 months. i ran 200 watts rms constantly and it thumped good with that. I bought a better amp knowing i'm gonna replace the sub anyways and it blew at 350 watts rms. But under that it had great sound especially for cheap
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Pelekoudas

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and good value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound for the size have a Anarchy 1000 watt amp bridged and it hits nicely, I would recommend to anyone, and customer service is AWESOME, had a problem with one of the 2 I ordered and they replaced it within 2 days!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a week but sounds great in a Toyota Corolla. For the price this is supper awesome. In my younger days I had two 12 inch kickers that cost me probably like 300 bucks for both that would wake up the neighborhood. Way Overkill. Now this 1 speaker is good enough for me. Sounds great and is super cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked it up and drove it with a planet audio amp. Both the sub and amp we're fairly inexpensive but sound great. I'm installing this into my Nissan Titan to offset the lack of bass from the factory. All in all this is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, perfect for my build.
customer_reviews.text: Sounded way better than I thought they would. 300 rms is a little far fetched with only a 30oz magnet but I have a pair taking 175 Watts true rms per sub and they handle it. Pretty sure that's the peak though. Have them tuned in relatively high at 54hz in a sealed over sized box. Any under about 50 hz they have a problem picking up. Great for high bass. Middle sub is 12" just to help match impedance and handle a little extra power.
customer_reviews.author: Random_reviews& projects

customer_reviews.title: Impressive power!
customer_reviews.text: The build and material was a little below my expectations but the performance this bad boy packs is incredible! I set 2 of these up with a BOSS AR1500MK monoblock wired in parallel and they kick ass!! Had to go straight to the manufacturer's website to pull the RMS ratings and impedance loads for both the speakers and amplifier. It's crucial info to get the perfect match! How you setup your amp settings is crucial as well!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: These speakers cant be beat for the price they are at
customer_reviews.text: I have used these subwoofers in 2 different cars and they work amazing every time. They will rattle your car in series or parallel.
customer_reviews.author: Review Robot

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy get a name brand
customer_reviews.text: It's a "600w subwoofer" but on a 500w Polk audio amp ( the boss amp I had previously went into protection with any sort of power behind it) and it blew in under an hour. Not even pushing it crazy and no bass boost and still couldn't hold the task
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LASTED ONE DAY
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality but terrible quality control. Popped after one single day. I have a low power system and i made sure not to run it hard so it can break in. ONE DAMN DAY IT LASTED. Sounded good for that single day
customer_reviews.author: Andres Arguelles

customer_reviews.title: Cheap little subwoofers
customer_reviews.text: It’s a cheap subwoofer. What can I say. I would advise against getting a 10” sub Tho. At least for me. It’s hard to find cheap boxes. With that being said. They do pack a punch. It’s enough to make my cars mirrors vibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Max Wieseler

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not they actually put out a good amount of bass for the money. Can only put 150w of clean power into them but their good for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Legacy

customer_reviews.title: 2002 Chevy Tahoe
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement for my Tahoe. Good quality and gives deep bass.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Save up and buy something better like a star or soundstream
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, only pushing 250 watts and I can't turn the gain up more than 1/8 of a turn without the voice coil wanting to smoke and pop. Save your money if you think this is gonna handle even 500 watts
customer_reviews.author: Deezznutzz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the money
customer_reviews.text: It sounds good for the money you spend, it is a $25 speaker after all. But the quality is good. It has good bass but breaks up at high levels and there is no way it olds the amount of amps advertised. But it’s definitely worth buying for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Cleavenger

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in my replacement sub for my theater room.
customer_reviews.text: Put it into an old terrible sounding sub for my entertainment room, and this fixed all the sound issues. Its tight and deep. Sounds great (for the money).
customer_reviews.author: ChibullsAN

customer_reviews.title: Oh this poor speaker. As it tries to be one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh this poor speaker. As it tries to be one of the cool kids it is really just a sub par step child. Blew in 5 mins of use WHILE TUNING THE AMP.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Webb

customer_reviews.title: FOR THE PRICE IT'S A WIN
customer_reviews.text: So for $30 bucks they do the job with 700 RMS watts. So far no problems and they do handle so heavy bass, lows are not that great. Biggest downfall the "silver plastic ring around the speaker is really cheap and will crack if screwed in too tight". But this $30 12in Sub is worth all 3,000 pennies.
customer_reviews.author: MicahBruceBahati

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Fosgate and JL Audio sub in the same spot and I’m most impressed by this one. Great value for the money. I just installed it, so if it fails to perform in time I will update my review. For now I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Brown

customer_reviews.title: The speaker worked fine..
customer_reviews.text: The speaker worked fine... for about one month, and then the voice coil detached from the membrane. The Amazon return window closed just a few days ago, so I can't return it for exchange or refund. My speaker (and money) is gone. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Budget Subs!
customer_reviews.text: These things sound great in my crew cab truck! My box was a bit smaller than the specs, but they sound awesome. I broke them in properly, and I'm pushing them with the Planet Audio 600w amp. Great budget setup!
customer_reviews.author: Joe N.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a pair of this subs for a few months and they work great. They have good clean bass but won’t rattle you car if that’s what your looking for. I would recommend the 1000 watt for both amp for it but adjust it so you don’t blow them out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for price
customer_reviews.text: At $25 a piece, they're great! Just be sure to properly break them in though. I've had pair of them for months now and still hit great
customer_reviews.author: Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fills the hole
customer_reviews.text: Good enough to fill a hole, don;t expect much though. I used to replace a factory sub which was just so so to begin with, but I feel the stock unit performed a bit better. This is not as efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Smith house

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome sub for the price! Great for our shop surround sound and cheap but good quality
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Laye

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Has potential but unfortunately when I received mine it was blown. It was separated at the cone and rattled really bad with the bass. I also bought the Boss Audio 1100 watt amp which works really well. I didn't replace my sub because it was only like $30 so I just put in my old sub. I helped a friend hook up the same system and his was fine at first but after a couple days quit working but with the excellent customer service they provided he was able to have everything replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt sound bad.
customer_reviews.text: For the price the quality isn't bad. Sounds pretty good but dont expect anything close to the mid or high end speakers. Fit my truck perfect and is an upgrade over factory sub.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Polk audio subwoofer replacement
customer_reviews.text: Installed woofer into Polk audio home subwoofer that blew the speaker. This sub works very well no distortion on current setup and has very good sound for a $25 sub very happy with results
customer_reviews.author: Zac C.

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, at all
customer_reviews.text: They may be cheap, but they work like a champ! Clear, concise sounds and a good bit of bass to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Big bass on a budget! Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Bumping bass for the money. Using the 200 watt Bluetooth amp with the Boss BE654 6.5 inch 300 w full range illuminated speakers. Great pairing!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Easter

customer_reviews.title: Basic subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: If you want a cheap subwoofer, these are for you. Only purchased to replace high end subs I removed from my car to sell it, didn’t want to leave empty holes in the custom rear package tray I made. So these served the purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: for 25$ you can't beat this deal - however!!! you have to build a box for it or enclosure or have it secured somehow, you cant have this thing flopping around or its gonna sound terrible. Also - this is 600 Max.. your only gonna get RMS power your putting out so for me thats 80W per channel.... keep that in mind...
customer_reviews.author: Captain Roy

customer_reviews.title: Value the money to no crack the sub take easy with this
customer_reviews.text: This is no my first boss sub, for me make more crisp sound in my car work well magnet is little done the work
customer_reviews.author: edwinarr

customer_reviews.title: ... don't call the laws on me lmao i highly recommend these subwoofers as long as you got a good ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that these subs are flipping awsome i bought three of of these and put them in sealed box i put the finished product in my 2015 chrysler 200 with plenty of room to spare running off a 1000 watt mono subwoofer amp and that shytt whams lol im addicted to bass so i think I will buy three more to make it an even six lol i hope the neighbors don't call the laws on me lmao i highly recommend these subwoofers as long as you got a good amp to push em
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Banner

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what happened but all it does Is buzz now
customer_reviews.text: Completed burn in Mounted in custom box built to ported specs Installed in truck powered by 150 rms watt amp Stopped working after 45minutes
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Just not high quality
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, mine only lasted a couple of minutes and it blew. Even though it was running under power.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing rocks! I would definitely buy another if this one ever blows up. I beat on it and it just takes it and sounds great
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Beast mode!
customer_reviews.text: Great sub for the price! Had it running for a few months now no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aboobika

customer_reviews.title: Momma approved
customer_reviews.text: If your not looking for a crazy hurt your kids ears subwoofer this is the speaker for you. Great durrablibity, easy DIY installation even for someone who knows nothing about speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany N Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: Blew in 1.5 months
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a 50 watt 4 ohm home theater powered sub enclosure. It blew in 1.5 months this is apparently rated for 600 watts. I only use it for movies turn up to 4 so should not have blown this easily
customer_reviews.author: WESLEYTRU

customer_reviews.title: I had used a dual brand speaker in a bandpass box previously and it sounded much better. If you just want a little extra bass ..
customer_reviews.text: The speaker was ok, I had used a dual brand speaker in a bandpass box previously and it sounded much better. If you just want a little extra bass it works fine, if you want it to thump get a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Very poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This sub hardly puts out bass .65 cubic foot sealed box is required i built a .68 cubic foot box..I also tried three separate amps no improvement. I put a ticket in with boss maybe the sub is defective. Cause i even did the 4 hour break in period...not happy, but i hope boss customer service makes it right.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: RIGHT FIT, RIGHT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A 2000 TAHOE, GOT IT TO REPLACE THE STOCK SUB, COULDNT GET EASIER, FIT THE STOCK BOX AN SOUNDS GREAT, FOR THE PRICE U CANT BEAT IT. THANK U
customer_reviews.author: DAN WEBB

customer_reviews.title: I did not order!
customer_reviews.text: I did not order this ! what the crap! I am 60 years old! Lucky for me I went to my grand sons and showed him and he bought it from me or you would have screwed me. he is a good man. did not want his grandmother hurting because of thieves!
customer_reviews.author: Theanna Benefiel

customer_reviews.title: Work great for bagger audio installs
customer_reviews.text: Bass and sound quality is great for a small budget single voice coil sub . Perform and sound great installed in hard saddle bags @ 100 continuous watts rms @ 4 ohm
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Like it but be careful if you’re replacing stock one
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nichols

customer_reviews.title: 12 inch subs that perform great for the price
customer_reviews.text: inexpensive and sounds good. I matched two of these with the "Q Power dual 12 inch vented speaker box with durable bed liner spray for a good sound in my truck bed. It thumps.
customer_reviews.author: Wabbit

customer_reviews.title: Blew up after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. Had this thing with a total of maybe 3 hours play time and it just randomly decided to blow. Followed the recommended break in, on a 200 watt amp turned up not even a quarter of the way.
customer_reviews.author: camoko

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Good little 8" subwoofer. Does all I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Normand

customer_reviews.title: Overall
customer_reviews.text: As I open the amazon package, I notice that the Boss package was opened before. There is a big dent in the Boss box, NOT on the amazon box. The woofer it self sounds fine, but as i take a closer look I notice the surround on the speaker is bent in a bit, the metal is bent in, pointing at the voice coil. Overall sounds good. This is my first Boss product and I am impressed. Even though it is bent, it still fit in my woofer enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad sub for the money.Try it!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for at least 4 months on a 100 watt amp and it still works and still sounds decent.
customer_reviews.author: Dino M

customer_reviews.title: connection tabs on speaker are a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy speaker for the price. If matched properly with the right amp they get loud! I recommend BOSS AR1500M. it works great with 2 or even 1 of these speakers. 2 ohm or 4 ohm respectively.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Prefect switch and fit for an old monsoon H3 stock speaker. Big difference!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!! Save your money!!! Don't buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The subwoofers meet my requirement but within 3 weeks of use all 6 of my subwoofer get a bad voice coil that can't be fixed (what boss audio said on the phone) your better off spending your money on a polk audio or a Pyle audio subwoofer. Same size same price but better workmanship put into these subwoofers
customer_reviews.author: Hunter M.

customer_reviews.title: Good budget speaker
customer_reviews.text: The speaker isn’t broke in yet, but the speaker is very quiet compared to the one I replaced. The quality seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lasted 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Granted it only costs a bit over $20, it only lasted 8 months. It blew with being powered by a lil 400w amp. Its rated 800w. Ya get what you pay for is the saying, just saying.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poorly made garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Had for only one month. Rated at 800 watts, I had only a 200 watt amp on it, and the cone completely separated from the voice coil. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this speaker for my Party Rocker Max from ION that had a blown speaker. Replaced the speaker with this new one and it is as good as new! Very satisfied with this purchase. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sutherland

product_meta.title: BOSS Audio Systems CXX8 8 Inch Car Subwoofer - 600 Watts Maximum Power, Single 4 Ohm Voice Coil, Easy Mounting, Sold Individually
product_meta.description: Style:8" 600 WattWith extreme looks and bass output, The CXX8 8" Chaos extreme Series single voice coil subwoofer from BOSS Audio is the stylish upgrade to your car's audio system with super-clear lows. With a metallic Black finish that accents any interior and impressive 600 watts of power handling, the CXX8 produces both looks and sound that stand out above the rest.
feature_bullets: Cone - Made from Polypropylene, The CXX8 8 Inch Car Subwoofer Provides a Resilient and Durable Material That Can Offer Great Sound with The Advantage of a Long-Lasting Subwoofer

Surround - Rubber has the ability to endure much punishment without any sign of damage. It complements the whole structure of the speaker by allowing constant abuse where it is most needed, without the wear and tear

Stamped Basket - A stamped basket can absorb and transfer much of the energy produced by the speaker. It has good corrosion resistance, good mechanical property, high thermal and electrical conductivity and retains strength at high temperatures.

Voice Coil - Our voice coils are able to withstand high temperatures yet maintain its strength and fatigue properties. Making our voice coils with this material gives our speakers the advantage of longer pay times with lower weights
Specs - Resonant Frequency: 49 Hz, Sensitivity SPL (1W/1m): 83 Db, Dimensions: 8. 25” x 8. 25” x 4. 3”

- BOSS Audio Systems provides a powerful 3-year platinum online dealer so long as the purchase is made through . We strongly encourage professional installation of this product to ensure proper and safe functionality

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,933 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Car Subwoofer Systems - Loaded or Amplified
